description: Construction of two-storey attached house to the side of No.448 and boundary treatment
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings Location Plan, 11215/01, 11215/02 Existing Elevations, 11215/02 Rev B Proposed House, 11215/05 Rev B, 11215/06 Rev C, 11215/07 Existing Block Plan and Design and Access Statement (received 28/05/2013) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  	 REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Ealing Draft Development Management DPD (2012) policies 7.4 and 7B; London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.4 and 7.6; and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted plans details of hard and soft landscaping works and details of boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. Hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and thereafter retained and maintained in perpetuity. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, residential amenity and community safety, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 13, and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6. | The extension to the vehicular access shall be constructed fully in accordance with the submitted details and once provided shall thereafter be maintained with no obstructions above 0.5 metre in height within the 1.5 metre by 1.5 metre pedestrian visibility splays to either side of the access, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: In the interests of pedestrian and vehicular safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan "New Plan for the Environment" (2004), and London Plan (July 2011) policy 6.3. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E or F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modifications), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration to the dwelling hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of the residents of adjoining properties and the dwelling hereby approved and the visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), and London Plan policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, to protect sensitive rooms from transport and commercial noise and achieve Ealing's internal criteria for sensitive rooms. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the dwellinghouse from road noise in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 5.5 and  4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration' and policies 1.1 (j) and 3.1 (e) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | No subdivision of the forecourt shall take place, it shall hereafter be shared between the occupants of the two dwellings on the proposal site.  REASON: To enable the occupants of both dwellings to enter and exit onto the classified road safely and in a forward gear, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Document SPD 10: Crossovers and Parking in Front Gardens' and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan policy 6.13 of the Ealing Draft Development Management DPD (2012). | TThe new residential unit hereby permitted shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards prior to their first occupation and shall be retained as such thereafter.      REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and policy 3.8 of the London Plan.
